summary: The document is an outside contact report from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) concerning former Secret Service Agent Abraham Bolden. It outlines a telephone conversation with Mr. William Foster from the Federal Probation Office, focusing on Bolden's prison record, parole supervision, and the distinctive elements of his case, such as the nondisclosure by authorities and his parole violation for discussing the Secret Service's foreknowledge of the JFK assassination with the media. Additionally, the report contains personal details about Bolden and his relatives.
key_findings: Abraham Bolden, a former Secret Service agent, had a case marked by authorities' nondisclosure.
Bolden breached his parole conditions by disclosing to the media the Secret Service's prior awareness of the JFK assassination.
Even after a witness recanted their testimony, Bolden's conviction remained unchanged.
The report includes comprehensive personal information regarding Bolden and his family members.
